meanings.definition: The quality or state of being heavy or having a lot of mass.
meanings.sent1: The weightiness of the boulder made it impossible to move.
meanings.sent2: The weightiness of the elephant caused the floor to creak.
meanings.sent3: The weightiness of the situation was evident when the tiny puppy tried to lift the huge bone.
meanings.sent4: The weightiness of the decision hung over her like a dark cloud.
meanings.sent5: The weightiness of the anchor dragged the boat down into the depths of the ocean.

meanings.definition: The importance or seriousness of something.
meanings.sent1: The weightiness of the matter required immediate attention.
meanings.sent2: The weightiness of the document was evident from the official seal.
meanings.sent3: The weightiness of the joke was lost on the young child who giggled uncontrollably.
meanings.sent4: The weightiness of her words lingered in the air long after she had spoken.
meanings.sent5: The weightiness of the responsibility weighed heavily on his shoulders.
